item.title: Report E-2024040039
item.description:
Report E-2024040039

Identified by scraper @ 2024-04-04T15:13:28+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-03-26
  • City: FINDLAY
  • State: OH
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R & L CARRIERS, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 4000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On March 26, 2024, one (1) 55-gallon drum of paint was punctured by a skid and released approximately two (2) gallons of product to the trailer interior. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from First Call Environmental (FCE) to remediate the impacted site. FCE personnel utilized hand tools and absorbents to remediate the paint-impacted dock door floor. The damaged drum and all impacted material was collected and containerized into two (2) 55-gallon drums and one (1) 95-gallon overpack and staged on site for transport and disposal.

item.title: Report E-2024030268
item.description:
Report E-2024030268

Identified by scraper @ 2024-04-04T15:13:28+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-03-07
  • City: WALBRIDGE
  • State: OH
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Rail
  • Carrier/Reporter: CSX TRANSPORTATION, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 75000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On 03/07/2024, at 1232 hours, personnel in the CSXT Walbridge, OH yard, discovered CHIU 258609, a loaded container of Waste Environmentally Hazardous Substance Solid N.O.S. (Benzene, Mercury UN3077 Class 9), leaking. The container was isolated and the shipper, Clean Harbors, notified. HEPACO, a CSXT emergency response contractor, was dispatched to the scene and found the container leaking from the door seam. It was presumed the release was due to a combination of an ineffective door seem and either a failure, or improper installation, of the box’s poly ethylene liner. Contractor personnel secured the package by applying additional sealant to the rear door of the container. The container was removed from the rail transportation and transported offsite via highway by the shipper. The issue was identified and corrective actions were communicated to the shipper’s representative (Angel Villa 972-533-4154).

item.title: Report E-2024040043
item.description:
Report E-2024040043

Identified by scraper @ 2024-04-04T15:13:28+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-03-01
  • City: LORDSTOWN
  • State: OH
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: It was reported that due to the container being impacted by a sharp object while unloading, approximately 5 gallons of MAT 50 Paint Thinner (hazardous - UN1263) was released. The caller stated that the released product was contained to the trailer floor. The SDS was reviewed with the terminal and they felt comfortable cleaning the release donning the proper PPE per SDS. The released product, damaged jerrican, and oil-dri were placed into an 8 gallon metal drum and staged in OS&D. There were no drains, soils or waterways reported to have been impacted by the release.
